cars.title: Mahindra XUV700
cars.description: The Mahindra XUV700 was launched in India on 14 August, 2021. The carmaker has announced prices for entry-level variants of second-generation of the SUV. The model will be offered in four variants including MX, AX3, AX5, and AX7.

cars.title: Tata Tigor EV
cars.description: Find a list of all 4 electric versions of Tata Tigor EV. This table includes on-road price which covers all costs like RTO and Insurance.

cars.title: Hyundai Venue
cars.description: Hyundai entered the highly competitive sub-4 metre segment with its Venue SUV in mid-2019. The vehicle is available in 19 variants across four trims, seven colours and three engine options. The compact SUV competes against the likes of Ford EcoSport, Nissan Magnite, Renault Kiger, Kia Sonet, Mahindra XUV300,

cars.title: Maruti Suzuki Swift
cars.description: Maruti Suzuki has launched the Swift facelift after the new generation was launched in India way back in the year 2018. The facelift gets a brand new engine and a handful of exterior and interior changes to give it a fresh look. It also gets costlier by Rs 15,000 to Rs 20,000 over the previous model with an inclusion of a

cars.title: Maruti Baleno
cars.description: The price of Maruti Baleno starts at Rs. 6.14 Lakh and goes upto Rs. 9.66 Lakh. Maruti Baleno is offered in 9 variants - the base model of Baleno is Sigma and the top variant Maruti Baleno Alpha CVT which comes at a price tag of Rs. 9.66 Lakh.

cars.title: Mahindra Thar
cars.description: The Mahindra Thar was launched in October 2020 with a starting price of Rs 9.80 lakh (ex-showroom). The SUV is available in six colours, two trims, and two engine options. The Thar does not have any direct rival and is in a league of its own.

cars.title: Audi Q7 Facelift
cars.description: Audi is preparing to bring one of its flagship cars to India. The second-generation Q7 was the most popular luxury SUV in the country. It received an update in late 2020.
